pages.title: Getting Wood
pages.text: Well, no use in lollygagging about for too long. If I'm going to be prepared, I need to get to work now.$(br2)I'll start by finding the nearest tree and punching it at the very base until it falls. Then, I'll need to gather up some rocks and sticks for my next move.
I'll eventually need to build a workshop; for now, I need a crafting table, to work smarter and not harder.$(br2)Until then, I can make a crude axe to get some planks.

Debarking comes first; I can turn stripped logs into planks, and sticks, if I need to. After, I can gather up more loose rocks and sticks and combine them with my crude axe to make implements for a crafting table:
Then, I can place the crafting tools on the plank I just processed earlier, like so:
Ta-da! A fully fledged crafting table. With this, I can now more efficiently saw up planks from logs, at a rate of three planks per wood log:
Additionally, I can create more complex items with my larger and more sturdy workspace. I should also look into making a $(thing)portable crafting mat$(), great for crafting on the go:
Now, I should look at making some basic tools. A $(thing)pickaxe$(), a weapon like an $(thing)arming sword$(), a $(thing)shield$() and a $(thing)drying rack$() sound like a good place to start.
